comments.author: batang_bitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: selezneve on October 30, 2023, 11:43:22 PMWhat if I launch a cosmetic brand completely associated with crypto in some way. Like , the purchase of cosmetic products of my company being available only with certain alt coin. I have seen many companies did this but many of them failed. It's because many people chooses to use those coins that are already established and they don't want to take risk buying something with their 'only' coin. They prefer to use fiat over their own coin on it thus, the customers will just avoid that brand. It's not going to work because those that I have seen were established but little to no success. So, for the smaller and unknown brands, you'll have hard time unless you work hard with a bit of luck is with you, you'll succeed.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: Quote from: selezneve on October 30, 2023, 11:43:22 PMWhat if I launch a cosmetic brand completely associated with crypto in some way. Like , the purchase of cosmetic products of my company being available only with certain alt coin. The idea looks great, but you might not completely get the kind of sales that you desire. You need to start up a shop that will help you make a profit, and at the same time, you want to promote crypto using that shop. That's understandable, but do you know that it's not just everyone that will like a product in your shop that will be a crypto user? The majority of people will like to pay with their fiat. So I will advise that if you want to make a shop like that, add both your desired altcons available as methods of payment and also allow the use of your local currency for purchase. That way, you can be rest assured that your business won't fail even before you start it up. If the business has now gained some value and constant customers, then you can evaluate between those monthly sales and check which method was mostly used to purchase products from your shop. From there,  you can know the next step to take.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Anything is possible. It can actually be done but that won't be your main problem at all. Marketing. This is where most cryptocurrencies business is failing. It's difficult to market anything in the crypto field, especially with the scams and hacks lurking in the shadows. If you are aiming for selling your cosmetics by means of old cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, or stablecoins then I don't think there will be much of a problem. But if you are trying to create your own altcoin then it adds a workload. A team to manage it, investors, maintenance, developers, and more. It's not like it can be done with just the flick of your finger. Then, you will have to market it and try your best to make it attractive to buyers.

comments.author: Sophokles
comments.body: Your product will not be that popular if you are thinking about only accepting crypto for your product payments as the crypto community that wants to use their crypto to buy goods is small and they are all over the globe. If you are thinking that this will popularize your brand you are totally wrong. Top online marketplaces already accept some crypto assets along with fiat currencies. You can do something similar to give your customers a better experience but using crypto as a bait to attract more consumers to your brand won't work really well.
